snippet: Communities damaged by Hurricane Sandy tried to let their children celebrate while keeping them safe.
abstract: Halloween is officially celebrated in New Jersey on Nov 5 after being postponed due to  Hurricane Sandy; with one in five homes in the state still without electricity and trees still draped across suburban streets, it is a struggle to make the holiday feel like normal, and some towns were forced to cancel it outright.
lead_paragraph: Communities damaged by Hurricane Sandy tried to let their children celebrate while keeping them safe.

headline.seo: In New Jersey, Halloween Is Canceled, Postponed and Redesigned
headline.main: No Turning the Lights Out on Halloween in New Jersey
headline.print_headline: No Turning the Lights Out on Halloween in New Jersey
